org.catechis.file
Class FileTestRecords

java.lang.Object
  org.catechis.file.FileTestRecords
All Implemented Interfaces:
TestRecords
public class FileTestRecords
extends java.lang.Object
implements TestRecords

This class stores and retrieves info from tests in two files, daily reading tests.record, and another one for writing, as well as the Momento object and other items relating to the applications actions being performed.

Be carefull to pass in the context path to the constructor to use some methods like getMomentoObject. Most methods are designed to take the path as an argument, however.

These lists can also be used to store a list of missed words that are for instance above level 0, so that they will not show up on the weekly word list, unles they have failed a test recently.

WordTestMemory

private String category;

private String type;

private String date;

private String score;

private String index;

private String number_correct;

private String level;

private String test_name;

createWordTestMemoryElement

addDailyTestRecord

public void addDailyTestRecord(WordTestResult wtr,
                               WordTestRecordOptions wtro)

Record a singe DailyWordTest from a WordTestMemory object.

Basically unbind the object into an element and add it to a file name daily reading/writing tests.record in the /files/user/ folder.

The text object is saved in bytes, and the date is saved as time in a long. These transformations happen within this method, so that the rest of the system can keep on using encoded text and string dates as it was first designed to use.

WordTestResult (set in DailyTestResultAction)

String text;

String definition;

String answer;

String grade;

String level; - not needed

int id; - not needed

String original_text;

String original_definition;

String original_level; - not needed

String encoding; - not needed

String date;

THE OBJECT WordTestRecordOptions is used to hold the options to decided what records should be saved.

private String type;

private String user_name;

private String root_path;

private boolean record_failed_tests;

private boolean record_passed_tests;

private String record_exclude_level;

private int record_limit;

setEncoding

getDailyTestRecords

public java.util.Vector getDailyTestRecords(java.lang.String user_name,
                                            java.lang.String type,
                                            java.lang.String root_path,
                                            java.util.Hashtable user_opts)
Load a vector of WordTestResults from a daily *type* tests.record file.

A typical entry looks like this:

1189742002000

-21-117-92-21-117-120-21-117-92

To attend

to iron

fail

2

3

no

Note the date is in milliseconds, and the text has been saved in bytes.

If it were a writing test, then the answer would also be saved in bytes.

These must be converted back into a string date and encoded strings.

The method populateWordTestResult lookes at each test element, and filters out tests thata are excluded due to settings in the user options file.

If a test is needed, it is then actually unbound into an object in unbindWTR.

Properties from the user options hash are:

record_failed_tests

record_passed_tests

Specified by:
getDailyTestRecords in interface TestRecords

populateWordTestResult

private WordTestResult populateWordTestResult(org.jdom.Element e,
                                              boolean pass,
                                              boolean fail,
                                              boolean changed,
                                              java.lang.String type)

Note level in the WordTestResult object is saved in the xml file as new_level...

Also, text, and possibly answer (fore writing tests) bust me encoded from bytes, and the date must be formatted from a long.

We ignore the changed argument right now. It seems we would need to know if the user wants to record a failed test changed to a pass, or the opposite.

Here is the xml record and the bean properties to show the difference: 1189742002000

-21-117-92-21-117-120-21-117-92

To attend

to iron

fail

2

3

no

private int id;

private String original_text;

private String original_definition;

private String original_level;

private String encoding;

private String date;

getSpecificDailyTestRecords

public java.util.Hashtable getSpecificDailyTestRecords(WordTestRecordOptions wtro)

This method is similar to getDailyTestRecords, ecept that is retuens only the text-definition pairs of WordTestResults that fit a specific criteria, such as exclude level 0 tests, because the user can get a list of level 0 words to study elsewhere, so what they want here are only words that are outside this range.

Extra properties can be added to the user_opts hash. Infact, all non-record test entries can be deleted to sdave memory, as they are mostly not used.

Properties from the user options hash are held in: WordTestRecordOptions

String type;

String user_name;

String root_path;

boolean record_failed_tests;

boolean record_passed_tests;

String record_exclude_level;

int record_limit;

record_exclude_level * this one is only useful when set to 0. a range might be more useful, and can be added later if it is deemed useful and important.

Despite being called *record* as in the verb sense, these are also used for retrieving records.

Specified by:
getSpecificDailyTestRecords in interface TestRecords

reverseTestRecord

public void reverseTestRecord(WordTestResult wtr,
                              WordTestRecordOptions wtro)

This method is called in the ChangeUpdateAction(defunct) or ChangeUpdateScoreAction to either delete a test that was stored because the user has reversd the test result to pass, or add a record if the opposite is the case.

We need to consider if the test should have been save to determine if there is a record to be deleted, or if a new record should be created.

WordTestResult String text; String definition; String answer; String grade; String level; int id; String original_text; String original_definition; String original_level; String encoding; String date; long word_id;

updateTestsStatus

public int updateTestsStatus(java.lang.String user_name,
                             java.lang.String subject)

This method increments the tests and daily_session_tests elements in the status.xml file.

It is used in the DailyTestResultAction/IntegratedTestResultAction and put in the session as daily_test_index.

The subject argument represents a folder inside the users main folder.

updateSessionStatus

public void updateSessionStatus()

This method increments the grand_index, daily_session_tests, word_test_elapsed_time and number_of_tests_in_week elements in the status.record file.

Used in IntegratedTestResultAction.

The subject argument represents a folder inside the users main folder.

calling methods must remember to call writeDocument() after all work is done when using this method.

updateSessionStatusUsingSharedDoc

public void updateSessionStatusUsingSharedDoc()

This method increments the grand_index, daily_session_tests, word_test_elapsed_time and number_of_tests_in_week elements in the status.record file.

Used in IntegratedTestResultAction.

The subject argument represents a folder inside the users main folder.

calling methods must remember to call writeDocument() after all work is done when using this method.

public long getDailySessionStartTime(java.lang.String user_name,

Get the time of the first session of a 24 hour period saved in the status.record file. The format is a long representing milliseconds from the getTime call on a date.

setDailyTestMark

public void setDailyTestMark(java.lang.String user_name,
                             java.lang.String subject,
                             int i,
                             int j)

This method saves the current place in the daily tests with i for the point in the list of categories, and j as the point in the list of words in that category. The format is Mdaily_test_index>i:j.

The subject arg represents a folder inside the users main folder.

getDailyTestMark

public java.lang.String getDailyTestMark(java.lang.String user_name,
                                         java.lang.String subject)

This method gets current place in the daily tests with i for the point in the list of categories, and j as the point in the list of words in that category. The format returned is a string like this i:j

The subject arg represents a folder inside the users main folder.

This was used for legacy DailyTestActions.

getTestsStatus

public int getTestsStatus(java.lang.String user_name,
                          java.lang.String subject)
This status is the grand total of daily *type* or integrated tests run. The daily_session_tests is also loaded and can get retrieved with the method: getDailySessionTests()

Replaced by getStatusRecord.

loadWordLevles

private void loadWordLevles(org.jdom.Element root)
Called in updateWordLevels, getTestsStatus, and getAndResetTestsStatus. The reading_and_writing_levels Hashtable is set from the status.record, along with number_of_words reading_average writing_average date and are then available thru getReadingAndWritingLevels().

The momento object records the status of actions. It has the following properties: action_name, action_time, action_id, action_type; Unlike other methods here, the user does not need to call writeDocument().

The momento object records the status of actions. It has the following properties: action_name, action_time, action_id, action_type; Unlike other methods here, the user does not need to call writeDocument().

Same as above but the caller must remember to write the doc later.
